definition: lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: Most of the time our attempt to be creative is merely aping what we have seen elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 大多時候，我們所嘗試的創意，不過是東施效顰而已。

sentences.english: No one's idea of excellence in conduct is that people should do absolutely nothing but copy one another.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一個人對於行爲的優越表現是完全東施效顰。

definition: lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to have no sense of shame/brazen
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
